parts.text: {"word":"borescope","priority":"☆☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"内視鏡、ボアスコープ（狭い場所や内部を観察するための光学機器）","english_definition":"an optical instrument for inspecting the interior of narrow tubes or cavities, such as gun barrels or engine cylinders.","examples":[{"sentence":"The mechanic used a borescope to examine the engine cylinders for damage.","translation":"整備士はボアスコープを使って、エンジンシリンダーの損傷を調べた。"},{"sentence":"A borescope is essential for inspecting the inside of aircraft engines.","translation":"ボアスコープは航空機エンジンの内部を検査するのに不可欠だ。"},{"sentence":"The inspector used a flexible borescope to navigate the complex piping system.","translation":"検査官は柔軟なボアスコープを使って、複雑な配管システムを調べた。"}],"collocations":["flexible borescope (可撓性ボアスコープ)","rigid borescope (硬性ボアスコープ)","video borescope (ビデオボアスコープ)","industrial borescope (工業用ボアスコープ)","inspect with a borescope (ボアスコープで検査する)","borescope inspection (ボアスコープ検査)"],"synonyms":["endoscope","fiberscope","inspection camera","videoscope"],"antonyms":[],"related_terms":["non-destructive testing (非破壊検査)","NDT (非破壊検査)","visual inspection (目視検査)","engine inspection (エンジン検査)","weld inspection (溶接検査)"],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"A borescope is a specialized type of endoscope used for visual inspection of hard-to-reach areas. It typically consists of a rigid or flexible tube with an optical system for viewing the remote object. Some borescopes also have a light source to illuminate the area being inspected. Video borescopes incorporate a small camera at the end of the tube, allowing the image to be displayed on a screen or recorded. Borescopes are widely used in industrial applications, such as inspecting engines, pipelines, and welds, as well as in medical applications.","priority":"★★☆"}],"etymology":{"value":"The term \"borescope\" is derived from \"bore,\" referring to a hole or cavity, and \"scope,\" referring to an instrument for viewing. The name reflects the instrument's primary function of inspecting the bores or internal cavities of objects.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈbɔːrskoʊp/","syllables":"bore-scope"},"level_frequency":{"level":"Technical","frequency_google_ngram":"Low","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"The term \"borescope\" refers to a technical instrument used for visual inspection of internal cavities. Understanding its meaning requires familiarity with technical contexts involving inspection and maintenance of machinery or structures. The word is not commonly used in everyday conversation.","priority":"★★☆"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The technician inserted the borescope into the engine to check for cracks.","translation":"技術者はエンジンにボアスコープを挿入して、亀裂がないか確認した。","type":"general","meaning_category":"inspection"},{"sentence":"We used a borescope to inspect the weld quality inside the pipe.","translation":"パイプ内部の溶接品質を検査するためにボアスコープを使用した。","type":"industrial","meaning_category":"inspection"},{"sentence":"The doctor used a small borescope to examine the patient's nasal passages.","translation":"医師は小さなボアスコープを使って患者の鼻腔を検査した。","type":"medical","meaning_category":"medical examination"}]}
